meanings.definition: A temporary structure used to support workers and materials during construction or repair.
meanings.sent1: The workers climbed the scaffolding to reach the top of the building.
meanings.sent2: The scaffolding was set up around the old church for renovation.
meanings.sent3: The birds perched on the scaffolding, curious about the construction below.
meanings.sent4: The scaffolding towered like a metal forest against the sky.
meanings.sent5: The clang of hammers echoed through the scaffolding as the workers hammered away.

meanings.definition: A system of support or guidance provided to help someone learn or develop skills.
meanings.sent1: The teacher provided scaffolding to help the students understand the difficult concept.
meanings.sent2: The scaffolding of mentorship was crucial for the new employees to succeed.
meanings.sent3: The scaffolding of encouragement lifted the student's spirits during the exam.
meanings.sent4: The scaffolding of knowledge built a strong foundation for the students' learning.
meanings.sent5: The scaffolding of feedback guided the writer to improve their work.
